description: Claude Code plugin that auto-generates video demos of web app changes. Phase 1: Local Playwright MVP

userStories.title: Create plugin structure
userStories.description: Set up Aura as a Claude Code plugin with proper structure
acceptanceCriteria: Create .claude-plugin/plugin.json with name, description, author
Create skills/record-demo/SKILL.md with placeholder
Create .mcp.json declaring Playwright dependency
Plugin can be loaded with: claude --plugin-dir ./aura

userStories.title: Detect web app and changed files
userStories.description: Skill prompts Claude to analyze git diff and identify what changed
acceptanceCriteria: Prompt instructs Claude to run git diff --name-only
Detect if project is web app (package.json with react/vue/next/vite)
Extract list of changed component/page files (.tsx, .jsx, .vue)
Identify likely affected routes from file paths (pages/, app/, routes/)

userStories.title: Start dev server and wait for ready
userStories.description: Skill prompts Claude to start the dev server before recording
acceptanceCriteria: Detect start script from package.json (dev, start, serve)
Start server in background with Bash tool
Poll localhost until server responds (try ports 3000, 5173, 8080, 4200)
Store server PID for cleanup later
userStories.notes: Server runs in background, skill handles cleanup

userStories.title: Navigate and screenshot with Playwright
userStories.description: Use Playwright MCP to browse the app and capture screenshots
acceptanceCriteria: Use mcp__playwright__browser_navigate to open localhost
Visit routes affected by changes
Use mcp__playwright__browser_take_screenshot for each page
Save screenshots to demos/[timestamp]/ folder
userStories.notes: User must have Playwright MCP configured

userStories.title: AI-driven interaction based on diff
userStories.description: Claude analyzes the diff and decides what to click/test
acceptanceCriteria: Skill prompts Claude to read the actual code changes
Identify new/changed interactive elements (buttons, forms, links)
Use mcp__playwright__browser_snapshot to see page structure
Use mcp__playwright__browser_click to interact with changed elements
userStories.notes: This is the smart part - Claude reads diff and decides actions

userStories.title: Generate summary and cleanup
userStories.description: Output summary of what was tested, stop server
acceptanceCriteria: Create demos/[timestamp]/summary.md with what was tested
List all screenshots taken with descriptions
Stop the dev server (kill PID)
Print demo folder path to user
userStories.notes: User can attach demos/ folder to PR
